li.a: NYS ESSA Funded Programs Complaint Procedures

p.strong: Evergreen Charter School will continue to update this page with the latest resources as it becomes available.

h3.strong: If you need to contact the school, please call the elementary school at 516-292-2060 or middle school at 516-216-5981 between the hours of 9:00 a.m. and 12:00 p.m., Monday-Friday.
Questions can also be e-mailed toÂ info@ecsli.org

header.h2: Instructions on How to Set Up WIFI at Home:

h3.span: Altice (formerly Cablevision) offers a free internet product for students with no Internet access at home.Â Installation charges are also waived. The relationship is directly between parent/guardian and Altice so the school districts and BOCES are not involved except to provide information
When a parent calls in, they should say they are calling about the offer for free internet service.Â
No documentation is required â just self-identification that they have a K-12 or college student in the household and do not currently have internet access at home.Â
There is no install fee or out of pocket costs for
If the address does have an outstanding balance from another account, there is a chance Altice may deny access unless that balance can be paid or can be proved as not their own.Â
Through the prompts, they will need to select
h3.b: new customer, new service, new Internet

La relaciÃ³n es directamente entre el padre/tutor y Altice, por lo que los distritos escolares y BOCES no estÃ¡n involucrados, excepto para proporcionar informaciÃ³n.

h3.strong: Los padres deben llamar al 1-866-200-9522 para inscribirse

No se requiere documentaciÃ³n, solo identificaciÃ³n de que tienen un estudiante en los grados de Kinder al grado 12 o un estudiante universitario en la familia y que actualmente no tienen acceso a Internet en el hogar.
